item.description:
The Festival Boston's inaugural winter film festival honors the passion, stunning visuals, jaw-dropping feats, and beautiful editing of the world's best ski and snowboard films. The festival features some of the world's best ski and snowboard films, and is in the likes of nothing Boston has seen before. The venue is the state-of-the-art Theatre 1 Boston at the boutique Revere Hotel. The event hopes to help raise money for The Esplanade Association, Future Boston Alliance, and Ellen's Heart and Soul to help make a positive impact while we share our love for winter.

Tickets can be purchased here: - http://bostonwinterfilmfestival.eventbrite.com/

Video Teaser -http://vimeo.com/50638012

 

 


Films and Ticket Options

The Snowboard Triple Feature:

"After Hours" by Ian Post @1:00pm

"Shaun Palmer: The Miserable Champion" by Chainsaw Productions @2:00pm

"Days of Chunder" by Never Summer Industries @2:50pm


The Ski Double Feature:

"WE: A Collection of Individuals" by Poor Boyz Productions and Red Bull Media House @3:30

"The Eighty Six" by Stept Productions @5:05


The Ski Triple Feature:

"WE: A Collection of Individuals" by Poor Boyz Productions and Red Bull Media House @3:30

"The Eighty Six" by Stept Productions @5:05

"Sunny" by Level 1 Productions @7:20 IF3 North American Film of the Year 2012

 

Standard Films:

"2112" by Standard Films @6:10


Level 1 Productions:

"Sunny" by Level 1 Productions @7:20 IF3 North American Film of the Year 2012

Headline Film- Teton Gravity Research:

"Jeremy Jones' Further" @ 8:45Exclusive showing headline feature, only 100 tickets available


*Plus surprise fillers and other action*


The festival is October 13, 2012 at 200 Stuart st. Boston and will run individual showings from 12pm - 10:30pm

Tickets can be purchased here: - http://bostonwinterfilmfestival.eventbrite.com/
item.how_to_find_us: Nick will be hosting this event as he is volunteering to this effort.
item.name: Boston Winter Film Festival
